user.title: Configure NoIP Monitor
user.description:
Enter your NoIP account credentials to monitor your dynamic DNS hostnames.

Your credentials are used to authenticate with the NoIP API and retrieve hostname information.

**Important:** If you have Two-Factor Authentication (2FA) enabled on your NoIP account, you must use an application-specific password instead of your regular password.

data_description.username: Your NoIP account username or email address
data_description.password: Your NoIP account password (use an application-specific password if you have 2FA enabled)

reconfigure.title: Reconfigure NoIP Monitor
reconfigure.description:
Update your NoIP account credentials.

**Important:** If you have Two-Factor Authentication (2FA) enabled on your NoIP account, you must use an application-specific password instead of your regular password.

data_description.username: Your NoIP account username or email address
data_description.password: Your NoIP account password (use an application-specific password if you have 2FA enabled)

error.cannot_connect: Failed to connect to NoIP API
error.invalid_auth: Invalid authentication credentials. If you have Two-Factor Authentication (2FA) enabled on your NoIP account, you need to generate and use an application-specific password instead of your regular password.

init.description:
Enter the NoIP hostnames you want to monitor (comma-separated). Example: {hostnames_example}

Leave empty to monitor all hostnames in your account.
